page.title: 04BURGHFIELD COMMON-HOUSING
page.content: The village once consisted of a few large houses set in spacious grounds, with humbler homes for the rural working classes.Two major council housing estates were built some thirty years ago,along with modest private estates,either as ribbon development along the main roads,or along smaller roads into the Common. Although normal for a builder to fill small gaps of land with the certainty of a quick sale,this had not produced any major change in the village's appearance until the latest develop- ments,which have dramatically extended the urban environment.This increased pressure on the limited amenities. Planning decisions can be contrever- sial,and the village now waits to see if the former WRNS camp on Clayhill Road will become an American enclave.
